lead_paragraph: What does it mean to be American? Hundreds of years have passed, and the question remains as charged as ever. But instead of watching the talking heads on cable news squawk over the answer, listen instead tonight to the authors Jamaica Kincaid, Gary Shteyngart, and others when they read excerpts from the new anthology "Becoming Americans: Four Centuries of Immigrant Writing" at the 92nd Street Y. The anthology includes letters, stories, and diaries documenting the immigrant experience in this country. The contributors will also share their personal experiences in a conversation moderated by the editor Ilan Stavans.
